Celebrations Flag Retirement Program Visitors FAQs Location & Directions Visiting COVID-19 Updates & Information Home Residents & Visitors Community Welcome to the City of Longwood The City of Longwood is located in Central Florida’s Seminole County, just north of Orlando. Incorporated and Unincorporated Longwood, which is comprised of zip codes 32750 and 32779, has a population of 56,457 and an average household income of $66,120.Incorporated Longwood is a city of approximately 17,000 people and 5.6 square miles and is conveniently located on Interstate 4 and State Road 434. Great schools, the ease of commuting to Orlando, the selection of real estate, and the rich history have made this award-winning City the choice of businesses and residents, alike. Learn more about the Demographics of incorporated Longwood . The City, pursuant to its Charter, follows a "Commission-Manager" form of government. Residents are served by five (5) non-partisan elected officials who are the policy-making body of the City. These elected officials, the City Commission , appoint the City Manager . The City Manager is the Chief Executive Officer of the City and is responsible for the administration and daily business operations of the City. Top Business Employer The City of Longwood has a strong business core which accounts for its daytime population of over 21,000. Some of the top employers include UPS, FedEx, Collis Roofing, Comprehensive Energy Services, and Pemberton Attachments. Numerous businesses business and industrial parks, including the Florida Central Commerce Park, are home to numerous companies including award-winning business incubators. See Business Award-Winning City In 2014 the City received recognition from WJXT Channel 4, an independent television station in Jacksonville, as 1 of the 4 safest places to raise a family in Florida. Most recently Bestplaces named Longwood as one of the top 10 best places to live in Florida, the 2015 Niche Rankings has Longwood as the 9th best suburb in Florida to raise a family and Nerdwallet ranked Longwood as the "7th Best Florida City to Start a Business". Most recently, Neighborhood Scout ranked Longwood as the second-best city in the state of Florida for families with children. School System The Seminole County School System plays an important role in drawing the population and a higher household income into the greater Longwood area. The Seminole Schools rank 5th out of 68 districts in the state and first in the greater Orlando area. Longwood's Lyman High School, ranked in the top 1.9% of all high schools nationally, is recognized as the best in the state for technical and pre-engineering curriculum. Leisure Services The City of Longwood Leisure Services Department provides recreational activities, special events, leagues, camps, and 9 parks that enhance the quality of life of the residents of Longwood. The Department comprises 3 divisions: Parks Services, Recreation Programs, and the Longwood Community Building . Efficient Transportation & the Historic District The City is also the site of 1 of the 13 stations along the 61-mile SunRail commuter rail line which provides regional transit from DeBary to Sand Lake Road in Orlando. In addition to its location at the intersection of 2 major roads, the SunRail station is located within the City’s Heritage Village TOD District and is in walking distance of the City's nationally recognized Historic District , which includes the City Hall complex, and Reiter Park. If you have any questions you can find contact information for all of the departments in our staff directory . Our menu contains all of the pages for local information, departments, and many other services. Thank you for your interest in the City and have a nice day! Search Locating Your Business Programs and Incentives State Registration and Licensing Business Tax Receipts Estimating Fees Finishing Touches Organizations That Assist Growth Small Business Development Home Business Starting a Business Locating Your Business Locating Your Business Things to Consider When Locating Your Business The first thing that we advise everyone is to reach out to the Community Development Department before signing a lease or purchase agreement or any other financial agreement. Too often, we have seen business owners sign a lease only to find a use is not allowable, or a particular unit or building requires much more in terms of necessary improvements than they expected. We are here to help identify issues ahead of time for you and hopefully save you time, money, and potential heartache as you open your Longwood business. You may reach out to our Economic Development Manager Tom Krueger , who will be able to act as your liaison to help answer these questions. We highly recommend that you set up a Pre-Development Inquiry session with our review team to get the answers you need from Planning, Building, Fire, and Public Works all at one time. To help get you started, we've created a list of things to consider when opening your business in Longwood. Available Properties The Community Development Department maintains a list of properties available for sale or lease in the form of an interactive map . The City's Economic Development Manager, Tom Krueger , is also available to provide even more detailed information about opportunities available in the city. Land Use and Zoning Each property in the City of Longwood is assigned a Future Land Use and Zoning category that affects the type of uses on a given site, as well as things like building height, how far back the building is set from the property line (setbacks), the amount of the lot that can be covered (impervious surface coverage), parking space requirements, and much more. The City's Planning staff is here to help you navigate the Development Code, but you can also review our Development standards and view a list of uses that have special regulations here . Permitting and Building Code Requirements for Existing Buildings and Tenant Spaces Locating in a unit within an existing shopping center or an existing building means paying extra attention to the Florida Building Code and how it may impact your bottom line. We highly recommend that you work with an engineer or architect to evaluate your selected site. Our review team - including our Building Official, Juan Lopez - is here to help you identify those potential costs ahead of time and provide time and cost-saving tips. Some of the common issues that we recommend you pay close attention to include: Opening a business in a unit that was used previously for a similar use (for example, a new retail business in a space that was previously used as a retail/mercantile business) will likely lead to fewer needed improvements versus opening something like a restaurant, bar, hair salon, event or gathering space, or similar uses in what was previously a retail space. Some potential required improvements that are affected by the tenant space you select include: Lighting, ventilation, and the number and type of plumbing fixtures (including bathrooms and water fountains) The maximum number of occupants and exits, as well as the distance to safely exit the building in case of a fire Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) requirements including the size and accessibility of bathrooms If you're located in a multi-tenant center, the improvements needed in your unit will in some cases be impacted by the adjacent unit(s). For example, opening a new restaurant, bar, or gathering space adjacent to a unit that has been used as an office or retail space may mean additional costs for you in providing structural firewalls, a sprinkler system, or an updated fire alarm system. For more information, be sure to check out our Permitting and Inspections section . Site Development and Redevelopment If you're looking to build a new building on an undeveloped site, tear down an existing building to build a new building, change the use of an existing building in a way that dramatically impacts the traffic generation or other impacts, or complete a major addition to an existing building, you will want to consult with a civil engineer very early in your project scoping and schedule a Pre-Development Inquiry session with our team. Some of the things you will want to consider include: Improvements to the stormwater management facilities on the site. The addition of impervious surfaces (buildings, concrete, asphalt, etc.) may result in the need for new or improved retention or detention areas to meet state standards for not only retaining water on site to prevent flooding but also to meet standards for water quality as it discharges to the aquifer. Parking for your business - both from a practical perspective and from a Development Code perspective. Whether the site is large enough and suitable to meet all the requirements for stormwater management, parking, landscaping, access, and other requirements. Search Employment Benefits Home Government Departments Human Resources Human Resources The City of Longwood employs approximately 167 people in numerous different positions throughout the City’s departments. The widely diverse workforce performs all functions needed to run a city. We strive to provide courteous, accommodating, responsive, and efficient customer service by ensuring a customer experience that is positive and exceeds expectations.  If you would like to be a member of our team, we encourage you to apply with us, see our current employment opportunities , or sign up to be placed on our email notification list. The Human Resources Department provides Employment Payroll Administration Labor Relations Employee Benefits Policy Development, Job Descriptions, and Pay Plans Employee Training Commercial Insurances (property, liability, automobile, etc.) Risk, Health and Safety Management Damage Claims Equal Opportunity Statement The City of Longwood is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEOP Utilization Report available upon request. Search Home Facilities Reiter Park 311 Warren Avenue Longwood, FL 32750 Contact Donna Alt-Bowes 407-260-3428 Hours Park is open daily from dawn to dusk **Exceptions: City events** Rating 5 average based on 3 votes Facilities Feature Overview View all facilities Reiter Park Documents Reiter Park Pavilions Reiter Park Amphitheater and Pavilion Rental Other Link Reiter Park Amphitheater & Pavilion Rental Form Features ADA Accessible Amphitheater Large Basketball Court Benches Exercise Equipment Fishing Flag Retirement Box Lightning Alert System Parking Pavilion Large Pavilion Small Picnic Areas Playground Restrooms Splash Pad Two (2) Tennis Courts Walking Track Reiter Park is a community park comprising 6 acres on the northeast corner of Warren Avenue and Milwee Avenue in the central part of the City, immediately west of downtown. Reiter Park contains a multi-use amphitheater (2,400 SF), an event lawn, a playground with equipment, 5 picnic pavilions, a splash pad, two tennis courts, one basketball court, a sensory garden, and a restroom building (500 SF). There are 504 linear feet of boardwalk (pedestrian bridges) within the park. A parking area is located off of W Warren Avenue with room for approximately 32 vehicles. The park is also accessible via a sidewalk along W Warren Avenue and Church Ave. Reiter Park Amphitheater & Pavilion Rentals All rental days are subject to availability and usage is at the discretion of the Leisure Services Department. View Reiter Park Amphitheater & Pavilion Rentals . *PLEASE DO NOT RELOCATE TABLES AND CHAIRS FROM ONE PAVILION TO ANOTHER. *REFUNDS WILL NOT BE ISSUED UNLESS THE LEISURE SERVICES DEPARTMENT CANCELS THE EVENT. *ALL CANCELLATIONS MUST BE RECEIVED THIRTY (30) DAYS BEFORE THE SCHEDULED RENTAL. Splash Pad The Splash Pad is open Tuesday to Sunday from 10:00 am to 6:00 pm. It is closed on Mondays for Maintenance. The splash pad will officially close for the season on Monday, November 4, 2024, and reopen on March 1, 2025. Flag Retirement Box If you would like to properly retire your old, worn, or torn American Flags, the City of Longwood has provided Reiter Park with a Flag Retirement box located by Fire Station 15! Lightning Alert System Reiter Park now has an Earth Networks Sferic Siren Lightning Alerting System protecting you from lightning and severe storms. Butterfly Garden The City of Longwood is a Monarch City! Search Facilities & Rentals Lightning Alerting Systems Armed Forces & First Responder Banner Program Feedling Wildlife Home Government Departments Leisure Services Parks Services Parks Services The City of Longwood owns and maintains a variety of parks that serve to enhance the quality of life in the Longwood community. Many of these are utilized for a variety of events and programs from neighborhood meetings, family reunions, and sports events to social functions, performances, and weddings. To report a problem with any facilities or to make staff aware of an issue, please use the REQUEST TRACKER City Parks Contact Us Adrian  Haughton Parks Supervisor Email Phone: 407-687-4351 Click on any Park Image for more information. Candyland Park Highland Hills Magnolia Park Reiter Park Sandalwood Shadow Hill Arbor Dog Park Smallworld Park Raven Park 9 1 1 1 Facilities & Rentals Find information on baseball fields, batting cages/bullpens, court, amphitheater, and pavilion rentals. Link to page Lightning Alerting Systems Both of Longwood's Parks: Candyland Sports Complex and Reiter Park now have Lightning Alerting Systems with an Earth Networks Sferic Siren Lightning Alerting System protecting you from lightning and severe storms.

When lightning and severe storms come near your location, the system will sound a loud horn and activate a flashing strobe light, indicating it is unsafe to be outdoors. Link to page Armed Forces & First Responder Banner Program The City of Longwood is both proud and excited to be able to offer the opportunity to those interested in purchasing a recognition or memorial banner for armed forces veterans as well as current or former first responders (police and fire). Link to page Feedling Wildlife Feeding wild animals may seem like a kind gesture—but it can have serious and lasting consequences for both wildlife and people. The Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC) strongly advises against feeding wild animals, including invasive species like Muscovy ducks. Search Popular Searches Fastrack Rides & Attractions Map Contact Us Contact Us Toggle Navigation Customer Services Local Residents Lost Property SignLive Contact Us Customer Services Local Residents Lost Property SignLive We're here to help Our friendly and knowledgeable team at Thorpe Park would love to answer your questions regarding any aspect of your trip. We are on hand to deal with any ticket enquiry or to help you plan your day and answer any questions that you may have prior to your thrilling visit to Thorpe Park. You can contact us in any of the below ways: Visit the help centre Check out the FAQ pages where answers to most questions can be found. Check out our Help Centre first before contacting us - it's the best place to get the help you need! Help Centre Amending Your Booking Use your booking portal which allows you to amend the dates of your tickets without contacting us. If you still need support in changing your ticket date, get in contact with our team and we can support you. Booking Portal Live Chat Thorpe Park's Digital Assistant is on hand to help you with any enquiries. Our agents are online daily from 9:30am - 4:30pm, or until half an hour before the park closes should you require further assistance. Outside of these hours, you will only be able to contact the Thorpe Bot. To start a chat, click the blue chat icon in the bottom right corner of the page Guest Enquiries If you need to send us and email with a question, you can use our enquiry form. Please remember to check our FAQs first as this is often the faster way to find out the information you need. Average Response Time: 3 Days Contact Form Telephone You can contact our call centre team on 01932 577131 Our agents are on hand to answer your call from 09:30am  - 16:00pm Monday to Friday. We can still be reached via Live Chat or email, for any assistance you may need outside of these times. Want to talk about something specific? Our dedicated teams are also available to help you with the below areas: Guest Feedback We understand the importance of guest feedback and we are keen to hear about your experience. We rely on guests reporting their experience to us to ensure we are always under continuous improvement. Average Response Time: 3 days Contact Customer Services Lost Property If you have a lost item whilst at the park, you can raise a claim with our friends at Boomerang. Visit our Lost Property page for more information and next steps on how to report your missing items(s). Lost Property School Bookings You can visit our dedicated Schools page for all information on organising a school trip with us, prices & planning, resources, and more. Find out more Overnight Stays If you have a query about your overnight stay, check out our Frequently Asked Questions. For anything that can't be answered here, please contact our team on shark.hotel@thorpe-park.co.uk Overnight Stays FAQs VIP Experiences To discuss a new or existing VIP package please email the VIP team on vip@thorpe-park.co.uk Email VIP Experiences Corporate Events To enquire or to book a corporate event, please contact our events team on events@thorpe-park.co.uk Email Corporate Events Charity Requests Here at Thorpe Park, we support Merlin's Magic Wand, which is a global children's charity that supports children facing challenges of serious illness, disability or adversity. For more information please see Merlin's Magic Wand . We often support charities and schools within the immediate locality of the park. Due to numerous requests, only registered charities and schools based within the local vicinity of the park will be considered. Please email all requests through to charity.requests@thorpe-park.co.uk . Please note that we are unable to accept or respond to letter requests unless an email address is given. As we receive many requests each day, we cannot respond to them all. If you have not heard from us within 2 weeks, then we regret to inform you that your request has been unsuccessful. Claims Notification Enquiries The UK Employers Liability Insurance Policy and the Global Public Liability Insurance Policy are both held with Chubb European Group Limited under Policy Number UKCANC33447. Claims are administered by Mclarens and should be submitted via the claims portal. The portal ID is D00029. If you do not have access to the claims portal, claims should be submitted to merlin.tpa@mclarens.com SignLive Contact us using British Sign Language (BSL) For more information click here Sign up to our Newsletter here! Sign up to receive our thrilling email newsletters... and get great offers and discounts!
